analyzed: @325b rgya gar skad du /

analyzed: a'arya sarba aan ta r'a li bi sho dha ni n'a ma dh'a ra n'i /

original: bod skad du; 'phags pa bar du gcod pa thams cad rnam par sbyong ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs /
analyzed: bod skad du; 'phags pa bar du gcod pa thams cad rnam par sbyong ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs /

original: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: chos la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: chos la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time:

original: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab kyi shar phyogs bram ze'i grong shing aa mra'i gnas zhes bya ba de'i byang phyogs na lus 'phags ri la dbang po'i brag phug na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab kyi shar phyogs bram ze'i grong shing aa mra'i gnas zhes bya ba de'i byang phyogs na lus 'phags ri la dbang po'i brag phug na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling on the Pāruṣyaka Mountain, in the Indraśaila cave to the north of the mango grove village of the brahmins to the east of Rājagṛha.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'chi 'pho'i chos su gyur te /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'chi 'pho'i chos su gyur te /
translated: Then Śakra, lord of the gods, was subject to the Dharma of death.

original: de'i tshe 'du byed kyi lhag ma lus pa'i snga ltas khong du chud nas skrag pa skyes te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'du byed kyi lhag ma lus pa'i snga ltas khong du chud nas skrag pa skyes te /
translated: At that time, having understood the signs of the remaining formations, fear arose.

original: btsun mo'i 'khor dang / g-yog dang bcas par bcom ldan 'das kyi gan du song nas /
analyzed: btsun mo'i 'khor dang / g-yog dang bcas par bcom ldan 'das kyi gan du song nas /
translated: Together with his retinue of queens and servants, he went into the presence of the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te lan gsum bskor ba byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te lan gsum bskor ba byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug ste /
translated: He bowed his head to the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated him three times, and sat to one side.

original: yang de'i tshe don du gnyer ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: yang de'i tshe don du gnyer ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de la bka' stsal pa /
translated: At that time, the Blessed One said to him,

original: koo shi ka de'i phyir khyod kyi rig pa'i gsang sngags gzhi gang dag gis bdud thams cad dang / phyir rgol ba thams cad dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad shin tu tshar bcad par 'gyur ba bar du gcod pa tham @326a *//
analyzed: koo shi ka de'i phyir khyod kyi rig pa'i gsang sngags gzhi gang dag gis bdud thams cad dang / phyir rgol ba thams cad dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad shin tu tshar bcad par 'gyur ba bar du gcod pa tham @326a *//
translated: “Kauśika, for that reason, I will explain the dhāraṇī mantra words that will completely subdue all māras, all adversaries, and all opponents, and purify all obstacles.

original: cad rnam par sbyong ba zhes bya ba'i rig pa'i gsang sngags gzhi rnams ngas bshad kyis nyon cig /
analyzed: cad rnam par sbyong ba zhes bya ba'i rig pa'i gsang sngags gzhi rnams ngas bshad kyis nyon cig /
translated: Listen to the dhāraṇī mantra words called the Purifier of All Obstacles.🔽Tadyathā:

analyzed: dharmma go sha sya /

original: koo shi ka khyod kyis rig pa'i gsang sngags gzhi dag ni khyed kyi rig pa'i gsang sngags gzhi gang dag gis bdud thams cad dang / phyir rgol ba thams cad dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad shin tu tshar bcad par 'gyur ba dag go /
analyzed: koo shi ka khyod kyis rig pa'i gsang sngags gzhi dag ni khyed kyi rig pa'i gsang sngags gzhi gang dag gis bdud thams cad dang / phyir rgol ba thams cad dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad shin tu tshar bcad par 'gyur ba dag go /
translated: “Kauśika, you should know that these dhāraṇī-mantra words are the dhāraṇī-mantra words by which all māras, all adversaries, and all opponents are utterly defeated.

original: 'di bzlas brjod byas na sngon gyi las kyi rnam bar smin pa ma gtogs par bar du gcod pa thams cad rnam par dag par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di bzlas brjod byas na sngon gyi las kyi rnam bar smin pa ma gtogs par bar du gcod pa thams cad rnam par dag par 'gyur /
translated: If you recite them, all obstacles will be purified, except for the ripening of past karma.

original: don thams cad kyang grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don thams cad kyang grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: All your aims will be accomplished.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces @326b bka' stsal ba dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin yi rangs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces @326b bka' stsal ba dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin yi rangs te /
translated: ” When the Blessed One had said this, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, was delighted

original: de'i tshe 'di skad du /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di skad du /

analyzed: kho bo lha las ma gyur la //

original: 'di nyid na ni 'dug bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di nyid na ni 'dug bzhin du /

original: kho bos tshe yang thob zin gyis //
analyzed: kho bos tshe yang thob zin gyis //

analyzed: grogs dag de ltar shes par gyis //🔽zhes ched du brjod pa ched du brjod do //

original: 'di'i mthu thams cad kyis bdag gi bar du gcod pa dang / bgegs dang log 'dren thams cad ni med par gyur cig /
analyzed: 'di'i mthu thams cad kyis bdag gi bar du gcod pa dang / bgegs dang log 'dren thams cad ni med par gyur cig /
translated: obstructions, and negative influences be removed.

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ni grub par gyur cig /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ni grub par gyur cig /
translated: May all that is excellent be accomplished.

original: na mo aa ke tu le na ge tsanda na ye sv'ah'a /🔽sarba ya tva s'a dha ni ye sv'ah'a /
analyzed: na mo aa ke tu le na ge tsanda na ye sv'ah'a / sarba ya tva s'a dha ni ye sv'ah'a /
translated: Namo aketule na ge candanaye svāhā.🔽Sarva yathā sādhaniye svāhā.

original: sarba dad ye bi sho dha ni ye sv'ah'a /
analyzed: sarba dad ye bi sho dha ni ye sv'ah'a /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: When the Blessed One had spoken thus,

original: lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin btsun mo'i 'khor dang bcas shing 'khor dang bcas pa dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de yi rangs te /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin btsun mo'i 'khor dang bcas shing 'khor dang bcas pa dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de yi rangs te /
translated: Śakra, Lord of the Gods, together with his retinue of queens and attendants, and the entire assembly,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
translated: rejoiced and praised the Blessed One's words.

original: 'phags pa bar du gcod pa thams cad rnam par sbyong ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs rdzogs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa bar du gcod pa thams cad rnam par sbyong ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs rdzogs so //
translated: The noble Dhāraṇī called Purifier of All Obstacles is complete.

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / zhu chen gyi lo tstsha ba bandhe ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa ////
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / zhu chen gyi lo tstsha ba bandhe ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa ////
translated: The Indian abbot Jinamitra and the translator-editor Bandhe Yeshe De translated and edited it, and then finalized it.
